Â  Â Â 



Currently, I belong to Cilab (Computational Intelligence Laboratory).
My current research focuses on brain diseases ğŸ§ , with an emphasis on graph-based computational approaches for understanding its underlying mechanisms.
I am particularly interested in state-of-the-art methods for graph construction in brain connectome representations
[Image of brain connectome graph] , including the development and evaluation of different graph-building strategies.
I also explore graph neural networks (GNNs) for modeling brain connectivity, focusing on general GNN applications as well as the explainability and interpretability of these models
[Image of a Graph Neural Network architecture] .
Additionally, I am fascinated by the mathematical foundations of machine learning, combining theoretical insights with practical applications to enhance both performance and interpretability.
I am strongly convinced of the role and importance of scientific research for humanity, and I strive to conduct work that contributes meaningfully to both knowledge and societal well-being.

Programming. Programming is the key. From a young age, I was captivated by it, especially C programming. Since then, I have never stopped learning, improving my skills, and exploring the depths of Computer Science. So, I earned a Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science and a Masterâ€™s degree in Data Science. Otherwise, I am a strong supporter of free information online, online anonymity, and free education. I believe everyone should have access to relevant study materials.
So, If you love low-level Programming, Deep Learning, and Mathematics, you are in the right place. Currently, Iâ€™m working with the latter two. So, Iâ€™m always on the lookout for new developments in deep learning, from new architectures to new ideas. In my free time, however, I also devote myself to the former, when I can!
